definition: one of two or more possible forms of a gene that are found at the same place on a chromosome
containing water; like water
of or like water; containing a lot of water
weak and/or pale
containing too much water; thin and having no taste
the quality of being good
the part of something that has a useful effect on somebody/something, especially somebody’s health
used to emphasize that you do not know something
used to emphasize the truth of what you are saying
used to express surprise
used to emphasize that what you are saying is true
because of kind feelings, without thinking about what advantage there will be for you
used to say that you are pleased about something
used after a verb to emphasize a particular hope, wish, etc.
a material, etc. that is water-repellent is specially treated so that water runs off it rather than going into it
that does not let water through easily
a straight tree with a mass of long leaves at the top, growing in tropical countries. There are several types of palm tree, some of which produce fruit.
the inner surface of the hand between the wrist and the fingers
to give somebody money so that they will do you a favour, especially tell your fortune
to give somebody money in order to persuade them to do something dishonest
to have complete control or influence over somebody
free from harmful bacteria
a male or female cell that joins with a cell of the opposite sex to form a zygote (= a single cell that develops into a person, animal or plant)
a single cell that develops into a person or animal, formed by the joining together of a male and a female gamete (= a cell that is provided by each parent)
containing two complete sets of chromosomes, one from each parent
containing the set of chromosomes from one parent only
a person who is in favour of the abolition of something, especially capital punishment (= punishment by death) or (in the past) slavery
micrometre (= a unit for measuring length, equal to one millionth of a metre)
a device that is used for recording sounds or for making your voice louder when you are speaking or singing to an audience
the fact of officially ending a law, an agreement, etc.
failure to carry out a responsibility or duty
one part of a story that is broadcast on television or radio in several parts
an event, a situation, or a period of time in somebody’s life, a novel, etc. that is important or interesting in some way
a period of time during which somebody is affected by a particular illness or a particular stage of a longer illness
any of the letters in the New Testament of the Bible, written by the first people who followed Christ
a long, serious letter on an important subject
an occasion when a volcano suddenly throws out burning rocks, smoke, etc.
an occasion when something starts happening, suddenly and violently
a sudden expression of very strong feelings, especially by shouting loudly
the sudden appearance of spots, etc. on your skin
a thin slice of meat with no bones in it, often covered with breadcrumbs and fried
a thick slice of meat, especially lamb or pork (= meat from a pig), that is cooked and served with the bone still attached
pieces of meat, fish, vegetables, etc. that are cut up and pressed together into a flat piece, covered with breadcrumbs and cooked
the act of bringing a feeling, a memory or an image into your mind
the state of being formed of many parts; the state of being difficult to understand
the features of a problem or situation that are difficult to understand
a diagram consisting of a line or lines, showing how two or more sets of numbers are related to each other
a sad or depressed state
a line or limit that separates two things, such as types of work, groups of people or areas of land
to reduce something by a large amount so that there is not enough left; to be reduced by a large amount
a straight iron bar, usually with a curved end, used for forcing open boxes and moving heavy objects
Japanese film and television animation, typically aimed at adults as well as children
to add a number to itself a particular number of times
to increase or make something increase very much in number or amount
to produce young animals, bacteria, etc. in large numbers
a sporting event that combines cross-country skiing and rifle shooting
the beginning or origin of something
connected with the outer sexual organs of a person or an animal
a racing sledge (= a vehicle for two or more people that slides over snow)
a garden plant with a mass of red, pink or white flowers on the end of each stem
a person who plays the oboe
that can be seen or noticed
a special building with a telescope or other equipment that scientists use to watch the stars, the weather, etc.
the state in which a person’s mind is completely filled with thoughts of one particular thing or person in a way that is not reasonable or normal
a person or thing that somebody thinks about too much
(in stories) a cruel and frightening giant who eats people
a very frightening person
a market in which there are only a few companies producing or selling a product or service. This can result in less competition and higher prices for customers.
a short opera, usually with a humorous subject
connected with the orbit of a planet or object in space
built around the edge of a town or city to reduce the amount of traffic travelling through the centre
a plant with brightly coloured flowers of unusual shapes. There are many different types of orchid and some of them are very rare.
the arrangement of a piece of music in parts so that it can be played by an orchestra
the act of organizing a complicated plan or event very carefully or secretly
either of the two organs in a woman’s body that produce eggs; a similar organ in female animals, birds and fish
the part of a plant that produces seeds
the fact of being careless, untidy or dirty in appearance or habits
